summary: Email correspondence between the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York and defense counsel regarding a discovery production in the case United States v. Maxwell (20 Cr. 330). The email corrects a Bates numbering error in a cover letter and discusses logistics for producing materials related to victims not referenced in the indictment.

events.title: Court Order for Discovery Production
events.description: The Court issued an order regarding discovery production in the case United States v. Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).

events.title: Discovery Production Regarding Victims
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office produced materials regarding victims who are not referenced in the indictment against Ghislaine Maxwell.

keyFacts: The document reveals ongoing discovery production in the case United States v. Maxwell (20 Cr. 330) as of March 2021.
The production includes materials regarding victims who are not referenced in the indictment, indicating a broader scope of the investigation.
A Bates numbering error (SDNY_GM_02742936 vs. SDNY_GM_02742963) was identified and corrected in the cover letter for the discovery production.
The production was to be delivered via an FTP site and a CD was to be sent to the MDC for the defendant (Ghislaine Maxwell) to review.
Multiple defense attorneys (Christian R Everdell, Bobbi Sternheim, Laura Menninger, Jeff Pagliuca) are actively involved in the case, representing Ghislaine Maxwell.
